br.com.estudio89.syncing

Class DataSyncHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • br.com.estudio89.syncing.DataSyncHelper

  • public class DataSyncHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for synchronizing all the data with the server. It communicates with all the SyncManagers e with the server (through ServerComm), exchanging data with all entities.
    Author:
    luccascorrea

      • sendDataToServer

        protected boolean sendDataToServer(java.lang.String identifier)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Method used for sending data do the server. This method has the following logic:
        1. Adds an identifier to the thread being executed.
        2. Looks for the token and, if it is null, stops the execution.
        3. Puts together a JSON object containing metadata (token, timestamp and device id).
        4. Loops through every SyncManager and, for each, checks if the items should be sent one by one or all at once. In case they should be sent one by one:
          1. Loops through every JSON object being sent
          2. For every object, executes a post request containing the object itself and the files associated with it.
          3. Process the send response.
          In case the items can be sent all at once:
          1. Adds all the data from all SyncManagers to a single JSON object as well as adds the files associated with these items.
        5. Checks if there are any data to be sent.
        6. Sends the data and processes the response.
        7. Posts an event indicating that data were sent.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the identifier of a particular SyncManager. This could be null.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if the operation was successful.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • runSynchronousSync

        protected boolean runSynchronousSync(java.lang.String identifier)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        This method wraps the internalRunSynchronousSync method, in order to report exceptions without crashing the app and using exponential backoff when the server is overloaded.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if the operation was successful
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • fullSynchronousSync

        public boolean fullSynchronousSync()
                            throws java.io.IOException
        This method runs a complete synchronous sync of all SyncManagers, that is, it first fetches new data from the server and then sends data that was created in the device (if there is anything to be sent). If there is already a sync operation running, it does not do anything.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if the operation was successful
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • partialSynchronousSync

        public boolean partialSynchronousSync(java.lang.String identifier)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        This method runs a synchronous sync of a particular SyncManagers, that is, it first fetches new data from the server and then sends data that was created in the device (if there is anything to be sent). If there is already a sync operation running, it does not do anything.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the identifier of a particular SyncManager
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if the operation was successful
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • partialSynchronousSync

        public boolean partialSynchronousSync(java.lang.String identifier,
                                      boolean allowDelay)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        This method runs a synchronous sync of a particular SyncManagers, that is, it first fetches new data from the server and then sends data that was created in the device (if there is anything to be sent). If there is already a sync operation running, it does not do anything.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the identifier of a particular SyncManager
        allowDelay - a boolean indicating if this request can be delayed according to the delay specified by the SyncManager
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if the operation was successful
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • fullAsynchronousSync

        public void fullAsynchronousSync()
        This method runs a complete asynchronous sync of all SyncManagers, that is, it first fetches new data from the server and then sends data that was created in the device (if there is anything to be sent). If there is already a sync operation running, it does not do anything.

      • partialAsynchronousSync

        public void partialAsynchronousSync(java.lang.String identifier)
        This method runs an asynchronous sync of a particular SyncManagers, that is, it first fetches new data from the server and then sends data that was created in the device (if there is anything to be sent). If there is already a sync operation running, it does not do anything.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the identifier of a particular SyncManager

      • partialAsynchronousSync

        public void partialAsynchronousSync(java.lang.String identifier,
                                    org.json.JSONObject parameters)
        This method runs an asynchronous sync of a particular SyncManagers, that is, it first fetches new data from the server and then sends (*) data that was created in the device (if there is anything to be sent). If there is already a sync operation running, it does not do anything. (*) If a JSONObject containing parameters is passed, then no data is sent after fetching data from the server. This is meant to be used when paginating requests.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the identifier of a particular SyncManager
        parameters - @JSONObject containing parameters to be sent along with the request

      • partialAsynchronousSync

        public void partialAsynchronousSync(java.lang.String identifier,
                                    org.json.JSONObject parameters,
                                    java.lang.Runnable successCallback,
                                    java.lang.Runnable failCallback)
        This method runs an asynchronous sync of a particular SyncManagers, that is, it first fetches new data from the server and then sends (*) data that was created in the device (if there is anything to be sent). If there is already a sync operation running, it does not do anything. (*) If a JSONObject containing parameters is passed, then no data is sent after fetching data from the server. This is meant to be used when paginating requests.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the identifier of a particular SyncManager
        parameters - @JSONObject containing parameters to be sent along with the request
        successCallback - a callback to be run if the request is successful
        failCallback - a callback to be run if the request is unsuccessful

      • canRunSync

        public boolean canRunSync(java.lang.String identifier,
                          org.json.JSONObject parameters)
        This method checks if a sync can be run. It will only be allowed if there isn't a sync already running.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the identifier of a particular SyncManager. This could be null.
        parameters - @JSONObject containing parameters to be sent along with the request. This is used internally.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if a sync can be run.

      • canRunSync

        public boolean canRunSync()
        This method checks if a sync can be run. It will only be allowed if there isn't a sync already running.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if a sync can be run.

      • hasModifiedData

        public boolean hasModifiedData()
        This method checks if any of the SyncManagers has data that should be sent to the server.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if there is data to be sent.

      • sendCaughtException

        public void sendCaughtException(java.lang.Throwable t)
        Sends an exception that was caught to Sentry.
        Parameters:
        t - the exception that was thrown.

      • stopSyncThreads

        public void stopSyncThreads()
        This method cleans the ThreadChecker. It is called when logging out, which assures that if a sync is running at that moment, no data will be saved to the database when it finishes as well as no timestamp will be changed.

        Adds an event to the event queue.
        Parameters:

        objects - the objects that should be added to the event.
